titles: A declaration of a strange and wonderfull monster: born in Kirkham parish in Lancashire (the childe of Mrs. Haughton, a Popish gentlewoman) the face of it upon the breast, and without a head (after the mother had wished rather to bear a childe without a head then a Roundhead) and had curst the Parliamnet [sic]. Attested by Mr. Fleetwood, minister of the same parish, under his own hand; and Mrs. Gattaker the mid-wife, and divers other eye-witnesses: whose testimony was brought up by a member of the House of Commons. Appointed to be printed according to order: and desired to be published in all the counties, cities, townes, and parishes in England: being the same copies that were presented to the Parliament.
notes: Annotation on Thomason copy: "March 3 1645"; the second 6 in imprint date crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Abnormalities, Human --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Religious aspects --  Early works to 1800.
